subjects.subject: machine learning and deep learning for remote sensing

metadata.title: Deforestation maps
metadata.description:
Deforestation maps resource.

Usage context

As a result of the mapping done in the "Detecting deforestation using data cubes and deep learning", classification maps are created, providing information about deforestation events in a region of the Rondônia state in Brazil. 

This resource can be used to compare the original results of the application with new execution results, enabling users to reproduce and validate the application.

Files

The generated results are into four different files:

  • SENTINEL-2_MSI_20LKP_2020-06-04_2021-08-26_probs_ltae.tif: Map with the class probabilities for the pixels of the data cube. These pixels are generated with the Deep Learning model. No spatial smoother has been applied to this map;
  • SENTINEL-2_MSI_20LKP_2020-06-04_2021-08-26_class_no_smooth.tif: Map with the classes assigned to the pixels of the data cube. This file was generated based on the values from the probability map without spatial smooth;
  • SENTINEL-2_MSI_20LKP_2020-06-04_2021-08-26_bayes_bayes_w9_s20.tif: Map with the class probabilities for the pixels of the data cube. These pixels are generated with the Deep Learning model. In addition, a spatial bayesian smooth method was applied to these probabilities to smooth the results;
  • SENTINEL-2_MSI_20LKP_2020-06-04_2021-08-26_class_bayes_w9_s20.tif: Map with the classes assigned to the pixels of the data cube. This file was generated based on the values from the probability map smoothed with the spatial bayesian method.

Accessing the results

To access and download the results, you can use the section below.

related_identifiers.title: sits package documentation
related_identifiers.description: Documentation page explaining how to use classification smoothers with the sits package.
